version_description: Big news. You can now use Apple Pay to make purchases from local businesses on Yelp. So go ahead — book an oceanside couples massage, get tickets to that John Mayer concert, or get those lobster rolls delivered.

Big news. You can now use Apple Pay to make purchases from local businesses on Yelp. So go ahead — book an oceanside couples massage, get tickets to that John Mayer concert, or get those lobster rolls delivered.
We removed precisely 37 bugs (and one intrepid spider, which we’re pretty sure isn’t technically a bug) from this version of the Yelp app.
We removed precisely 37 bugs (and one intrepid spider, which we’re pretty sure isn’t technically a bug) from this version of the Yelp app.

It’s finally happened. Can you believe it? We did it! We did it at last! The Yelp app is completely bug-free. UPDATE: OK, not quite. Maybe next time.
Bug fixes and various improvements
They're creepy, crawly, and totally gross. That's right, we're talking about bugs. The good news? We've removed a bunch from this version of the Yelp App.

Tasty food—good. Being lost—bad. We totally get that. That’s why in this version of the Yelp App we revamped our search experience and made the map more powerful. Basically, finding what you want and where you need to go is going to be way better.

Tasty food—good. Being lost—bad. We totally get that. That’s why in this version of the Yelp App we revamped our search experience and made the map more powerful. Basically, finding what you want and where you need to go is going to be way better.

New to Yelp? Don’t worry; we got you covered. Our “me” tab—which is where you put everything about you—has a new feature that easily teaches you about the app and helps you discover cool core features.

On our Netflix queue this week: A Bug’s Life, because we love cartoon bugs. On the other hand, we hate software bugs and have annihilated a bunch of them in the app.

We hear people love apps with multiple choice questions, so here’s one. Which of the following is new in the Yelp app: A) It’s faster and less buggy; B) It’s got a cool new blue background; or C) All of the above. If you answered C, you were wrong. It’s j

We hear people love apps with multiple choice questions, so here’s one. Which of the following is new in the Yelp app: A) It’s faster and less buggy; B) It’s got a cool new blue background; or C) All of the above. If you answered C, you were wrong. It’s j

We’ve decided to start referring to “performance improvements” as “app engine calibrations” because it sounds cooler. Therefore: For this version, we’ve further calibrated the app engine. See what we mean? Also, we fixed a bunch of bugs.

Due to a typo in the previous version's code, Yelp briefly became self-aware. We've fixed that along with a few other bugs. Please disregard any poetic, philosophical, and/or menacing messages you received from the app recently.

Due to a typo in the previous version's code, Yelp briefly became self-aware. We've fixed that along with a few other bugs. Please disregard any poetic, philosophical, and/or menacing messages you received from the app recently.

Spring has finally arrived in most of North America, except, apparently, in the Midwest. We hope you’ll enjoy the sunshine and warm breezes assured that there are now fewer bugs in the app. To our Midwestern neighbors: Hang in there! On the bright side, w

Spring has finally arrived in most of North America, except, apparently, in the Midwest. We hope you’ll enjoy the sunshine and warm breezes assured that there are now fewer bugs in the app. To our Midwestern neighbors: Hang in there! On the bright side, w

May is here! We decided to celebrate by creating an extensive list of things we love about this miracle month. We won’t bore you with the details, but sunshine, flowers, and freshly mowed grass definitely made the cut. What didn’t? Bugs in our app. These

Bug fixes and various improvements

Two things. 1) We’re gauging interest from the community in subscribing to an analog version of Yelp. Each copy will weigh roughly 60 metric tons. Shipping will not be included. 2) We fixed some bugs.

Two things. 1) We’re gauging interest from the community in subscribing to an analog version of Yelp. Each copy will weigh roughly 60 metric tons. Shipping will not be included. 2) We fixed some bugs.

Sometimes you successfully eliminate a bug. Sometimes you fail to eliminate the bug. Sometimes you fail 27 times in a row. It's OK! Pick yourself back up again. There's always next season. Or, uh, next version. (We did manage to fix some bugs, though, res

Fun fact: The name Yelp is derived from the Welsh word “Ylpllannerchrugog”, which loosely translates to “Those who rid the app of bugs.”
Fun fact: The name Yelp is derived from the Welsh word “Ylpllannerchrugog”, which loosely translates to “Those who rid the app of bugs.”

Bug fixes and various improvements

Our engineers have been working around the clock to fix bugs and improve performance in the app. The dumb clock is like ten feet wide and it's right in front of Julie's desk, so we don't really have much choice.

Our engineers have been working around the clock to fix bugs and improve performance in the app. The dumb clock is like ten feet wide and it's right in front of Julie's desk, so we don't really have much choice.

Things we did: Got rid of some bugs in the app. Things we didn’t do, but should have: Rolled out Request A Ride, a button that summons one of our interns to give you a piggyback ride to the nearest brunch spot.

Things we did: Got rid of some bugs in the app. Things we didn’t do, but should have: Rolled out Request A Ride, a button that summons one of our interns to give you a piggyback ride to the nearest brunch spot.

“Entomophobia” is the fear of bugs, while “Scriptophobia” is the fear of running out of things to write for a release note about removing bugs from the app.
“Entomophobia” is the fear of bugs, while “Scriptophobia” is the fear of running out of things to write for a release note about removing bugs from the app.

A bug obituary: SAN FRANCISCO — A bunch of bugs died this week when they were found and promptly obliterated by Yelp engineers. They are survived by a bunch of other bugs, which haven’t been found yet… but will.

A few things you should know:
1) This update has a few minor enhancements and bug fixes.
2) We really like your socks.
3) We can't actually see your socks, but we assume they're a great pair of socks because you're pretty great.

Every now and then, with a little bit of luck and a little bit of courage, a bug in the app can grow into a wonderful new feature. This isn’t one of those times. We eliminated a whole bunch of bugs. Better luck next time.

A poem: You’re going to want to give us some hugs
Because we have deleted an awful lot of bugs.
We didn’t sweep them under any rugs.
We completely obliterated them and we hate rhyming.

Here’s a Halloween story just for you: Once upon a time, there were bugs that lived peacefully in our app. And then aliens disintegrated them! And it turns out we were the aliens all along. Twist!
Here’s a Halloween story just for you: Once upon a time, there were bugs that lived peacefully in our app. And then aliens disintegrated them! And it turns out we were the aliens all along. Twist!

We’re always talking about bugs, but you know what doesn’t get enough credit? Performance improvements. Yeah, you heard us. They matter too. Here’s to you, performance improvements. We see you. (we did also fix some bugs tho)

We’re always talking about bugs, but you know what doesn’t get enough credit? Performance improvements. Yeah, you heard us. They matter too. Here’s to you, performance improvements. We see you. (we did also fix some bugs tho)

The holiday season is officially upon us. We’re already preparing thoughtful gifts for all the bugs in the Yelp app. The gift is obliteration. Every bug gets a piece, naughty or nice.
The holiday season is officially upon us. We’re already preparing thoughtful gifts for all the bugs in the Yelp app. The gift is obliteration. Every bug gets a piece, naughty or nice.
This season, we’re looking forward to the Bug Armistice Day on December 25, when we’ll stop destroying bugs and celebrate together for the day. That day is not today. Today we fixed a lot of bugs.
This season, we’re looking forward to the Bug Armistice Day on December 25, when we’ll stop destroying bugs and celebrate together for the day. That day is not today. Today we fixed a lot of bugs.

We apologize to anyone who had problems with the app this week. We trained a neural net to eliminate all the bugs in the app and it deleted everything. We had to roll everything back. To be fair, we were 100% bug-free... briefly.

We apologize to anyone who had problems with the app this week. We trained a neural net to eliminate all the bugs in the app and it deleted everything. We had to roll everything back. To be fair, we were 100% bug-free... briefly.

We got rid of some bugs this week. Pretty efficiently. Too efficiently. Now we have all this time on our hands. Do we finally take the time to look into getting a hobby? Is stamp collecting still a thing? Is trying to find a hobby considered a hobby? Neve

We got rid of some bugs this week. Pretty efficiently. Too efficiently. Now we have all this time on our hands. Do we finally take the time to look into getting a hobby? Is stamp collecting still a thing? Is trying to find a hobby considered a hobby? Neve
If we get rid of all the bugs in the app, but didn't write a release note, did it even happen? Catch us next time for our weekly existential crisis.
If we get rid of all the bugs in the app, but didn't write a release note, did it even happen? Catch us next time for our weekly existential crisis.
Fun fact: The first engineers didn't call app bugs "bugs." They called them "whoopsies." Other fun fact: That's not true, we just made it up. Anyway, fixed some whoopsies for this release.
Fun fact: The first engineers didn't call app bugs "bugs." They called them "whoopsies." Other fun fact: That's not true, we just made it up. Anyway, fixed some whoopsies for this release.

Hey there, Lisa. Your name probably isn’t Lisa. But we’re trying out this whole personalization thing. Unless your name is Lisa. Then this is probably pretty exciting. Well Lisa, we got rid of some bugs this week.

Big news! We completely revamped the app. It can now walk the dog, mix you a drink, and communicate via telepathy. Oh, wait. That's the release note for January 7th, 2051. This week is just bug fixes. Sorry about the confusion!
Bug fixes and various improvements
Bug fixes and various improvements

Hey guys, welcome to our update! This week we got rid of some bugs. Yay! Don’t forget to like, comment, and subscribe* to our channel to see what happens next week :)
*Somebody told us this would keep us relevant. Are we doing it right?
Bug fixes and various improvements
We’ve started a new game. For every bug we get rid of we take a shot of... espresso. We’re all pretty hyped about it. We should probably switch to decaf.
Bug fixes and various improvements
We read a story in high school about a guy who wakes up one morning and realizes he's turned into a bug. We never want that to happen to our app, so we got rid of a few bugs with this release.
Bug fixes and various improvements
Bug fixes and various improvements

Don't you love it when you look at the clock and it's 12:34? Is there anything more satisfying? Okay, yes, there are a few things like ice cream and extra sleep, but 12:34 is totally up there. Anyhoo, here's an improved version of the app.

Don't you love it when you look at the clock and it's 12:34? Is there anything more satisfying? Okay, yes, there are a few things like ice cream and extra sleep, but 12:34 is totally up there. Anyhoo, here's an improved version of the app.

Here’s some quick summer tips!
1. updating your app is the best way to get rid of bugs.
2. switching your office chair to a beach chair is the easiest way to feel like you’re on vacay.
*beach chair may annoy other coworkers, but relax you’re on v

A wise three year old once asked us, "Why isn't there a robot that makes pancakes?" We didn't have a good answer, but if we all dream big and work together maybe we can make it a reality. In the meantime, we squashed a few bugs in the app.

1. Your shower singing really is that good
2. You deserve garlic fries today
3. This release squashed some bugs"

Hi. Are you intrigued by the idea of churro-ice cream fusion? Do you like putting on cozy flannel pajamas and/or looking at Fall foliage? Or have you ever wanted to tell us something but you weren't sure how? Give us a follow on FB, IG, and Twitter @yelp<

Hi. Are you intrigued by the idea of churro-ice cream fusion? Do you like putting on cozy flannel pajamas and/or looking at Fall foliage? Or have you ever wanted to tell us something but you weren't sure how? Give us a follow on FB, IG, and Twitter @yelp<

It’s pumpkin-spice season. But don’t worry, we got rid of some bugs in-between sipping on our pumpkin-spice latte, eating our pumpkin-spice muffin, and sticking scratch-n-sniff, pumpkin-spice scented stickers on literally everything we own. Too much pumpk

It’s pumpkin-spice season. But don’t worry, we got rid of some bugs in-between sipping on our pumpkin-spice latte, eating our pumpkin-spice muffin, and sticking scratch-n-sniff, pumpkin-spice scented stickers on literally everything we own. Too much pumpk

We found a few bugs in the app so we gave it some chicken noodle soup and tons of bed rest. Anyway, the bugs are gone now and the app is feeling much better. Home sick from work? Talk to us on social @yelp

We found a few bugs in the app so we gave it some chicken noodle soup and tons of bed rest. Anyway, the bugs are gone now and the app is feeling much better. Home sick from work? Talk to us on social @yelp

We got rid of some bugs this week. Even though the office has been very cold, and we’re constantly wrapped in blankets—burrito style—which everyone knows makes everything more difficult. (That’s just science.)

We got rid of some bugs this week. Even though the office has been very cold, and we’re constantly wrapped in blankets—burrito style—which everyone knows makes everything more difficult. (That’s just science.)

We hopped on Yelp to find a dentist and ended up realizing there were a few bugs in the app. Don't worry though. After we got rid of the bugs, we still had time to get a 5-star root canal. Anyway, hope you're having a great day.

We fixed a few things in the app, but we mostly we wanted to say we hope you’re holding up alright and that we're working hard to find ways to support you and local businesses. Updates coming soon in the app and on our blog. In the meantime, if you’re loo

What isn’t new might be a better question. For starters, we released an iPad app that features a new delivery tab and collections, so that’s pretty exciting. We also sent some bugs home, indefinitely.

What isn’t new might be a better question. For starters, we released an iPad app that features a new delivery tab and collections, so that’s pretty exciting. We also sent some bugs home, indefinitely.

We’ve removed some bugs and we’re still working on more ways to help you and local businesses. Keep an eye on the app as we’ll be regularly adding more helpful features. Stay safe and healthy, everyone.

- Add your preferences to find what you love faster in search
- Browse popular dishes photos based on community faves o

- Add your preferences to find what you love faster in search

Bug fixes and various improvements

As usual, we made a few updates to the app. Also as usual, we hope you and your family are doing well and staying safe.

Got the iPad app? Enjoy these new features:
